newsitem.title: FRANCE: MOTOR RACING-SCHUMACHER ON POLE FOR FRENCH GRAND PRIX.
newsitem.headline: MOTOR RACING-SCHUMACHER ON POLE FOR FRENCH GRAND PRIX.

text.p: World championship leader Michael Schumacher on Saturday secured pole position for the French Grand Prix with a strong performance in the early stages of a German-dominated qualifying session.

Schumacher, in his Ferrari, clocked the best time of one minute 14.548 seconds after only 13 minutes of the hour of frantic activity on the Magny-Cours circuit and then relaxed as his rivals attempted to improve on his time.
Schumacher made two further runs without trimming his time but was challenged strongly by both his 21-year-old brother Ralf, in a Jordan, and fellow German Heinz-Harald Frentzen in a Williams.
Frentzen will share the front row of the grid with Schumacher, whose pole was the 16th of his career and his second in succession this year. Frentzen clocked 1:14.749.
Ralf Schumacher was third fastest, the younger of the two racing drivers from Kerpen grabbing the best grid spot of his fledgling Formula One career.

Canadian Jacques Villeneuve, who is second in the title race, wound up fourth fastest in the second Williams after recovering from a heavy accident during the morning's free practice session when he spun backwards off the track into a tyre barrier.
Briton Eddie Irvine was fifth fastest in the second Ferrari ahead of Italian Jarno Trulli, making his debut for the Prost team as replacement for injured Frenchman Olivier Panis.
